description: Triangle of numbers of irreducible Euler sums.
links: D. J. Broadhurst, On the enumeration of irreducible k-fold Euler sums and their roles in knot theory and field theory

R. P. Loh, A. G. Shannon, A. F. Horadam, Divisibility Criteria and Sequence Generators Associated with Fermat Coefficients, Preprint, 1980. [Taking every other row of this triangle gives the triangle (A258708) in Table 3.]
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := (2/(n+k))*Sum[ If[ EvenQ[d], MoebiusMu[d/2]*Binomial[(n+k)/d, (n-k)/d], 0], {d, Intersection[ Divisors[n+k], Divisors[n-k]]}]; t[1, 1] = t[2, 1] = 1;row[1] = row[2] = {1}; row[n_] := Table[t[n, k], {k, 2 - Mod[n, 2], n-1, 2}]; Flatten[ Table[ row[n], {n, 1, 17}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 15 2012, after _David Broadhurst_ *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _David Broadhurst_
